arts.ttl: Roefs in inspired form to earn Sunderland battling Palace point
arts.sum: FREE TO WATCH: Highlights from the Premier League clash between Crystal Palace and Sunderland.

arts.ttl: Robin Roefs heroics earn Sunderland deserved point at Crystal Palace
arts.sum: First the positive news for Crystal Palace. Oliver Glasner’s side are now 15 matches unbeaten in a run that stretches back to their 5-0 thrashing by Newcastle in mid-April. But having endured a dramatic end to the transfer window that saw chair Steve Parish pull the plug on captain Marc Guéhi’s move to Liverpool, Glasner will have been hoping for more. While Guéhi was barely troubled as he eased back into his role on the left side of Palace’s three-man defence with the minimum of fuss, a spirited Sunderland deservedly left with a point after thriving in their role as spoilers. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Andy’s Player Ratings: Crystal Palace 0-0 Sunderland
arts.sum: Robin Roefs: 9/10 A great all round performance by Roefs, made a number of really good saves, was confident when coming to claim high balls and unflappable with the ball at his feet. Trai Hume: 8/10 Good defensive display by Hume, put in a couple of customary sliding tackles where he wins the ball cleanly […]

arts.ttl: New signing Yeremy Pino misses golden chance on debut in Crystal Palace stalemate
arts.sum: Crystal Palace 0-0 Sunderland: Pino had the best chance of the game in the 36th minute.

arts.ttl: Sunderland frustrate Palace to earn point at Selhurst Park
arts.sum: Crystal Palace were forced to settle for a point after a frustrating goalless draw against newly promoted Sunderland at Selhurst Park.

arts.ttl: Premier League LIVE: Follow the packed Saturday schedule
arts.sum:
Live updates from around the grounds following Arsenal's early kick-off win over Forest.
Everton, Villa, Leeds and Newcastle among the teams in action.

arts.ttl: Regis Le Bris pleased with his strike force ahead of Crystal Palace clash
arts.sum: With three different striking options at his disposal, this gives Le Bris the option to select his starting number nine based on the team they are facing - a positive choice to have. Le Bris once again emphasised the importance of competition in his squad and insisted that those who have not been in the starting eleven in the opening stages of this season will get their opportunities.

arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner teases at ‘starting debut’ for summer signing against Sunderland
arts.sum: There is a good chance that Yeremy Pino makes his starting debut for Crystal Palace tomorrow.” Oliver Glasner talked to the media as Crystal Palace prepare to build on a strong start to the season against Sunderland .

arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner gives appraisal of Sunderland’s squad before the battle with the Black Cats
arts.sum: “We've had a very good start to the season, and we want to follow our pathway, play how we played, and continue improving our game, enjoying our game, and continue, of course, being successful.” “There’s a good mixture between young players on their upside and also very experienced players like Granit Xhaka, and Nordi Mukiele, or Omar Alderete : I know all three from the Bundesliga .”

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace vs Sunderland – Match Preview and Team News
arts.sum: Crystal Palace will put the Premier League’s current longest unbeaten run on the line when they host a confident Sunderland side at Selhurst Park on Saturday. The Eagles are in formidable form, unbeaten in nine league games dating back to last season, but they face a Black Cats team that has made an impressive start […] The post Crystal Palace vs Sunderland – Match Preview and Team News first appeared on The Football Faithful.
